about.name: Akio Ohmoto
about.profession: Aspiring web app developer and product marketer
about.education: Computer Science and Communications major at Boston College
about.summary: Hi there! My name is Akio, and I'm an aspiring web app developer and product marketer. I'm passionate about creating intuitive, user-friendly web applications that solve real-world problems while delivering a seamless user experience. I'm a computer science and communications major at Boston College, with a strong interest in both technology and storytelling. Whether I'm coding, designing, or strategizing, I thrive on collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning.

news.title: EagleRide at HackTheHeights 2024
news.description: I recently had the exciting opportunity to participate in HackTheHeights 2024, Boston College's annual hackathon! Over the course of the event, I worked alongside peers to develop EagleRide, a ride-sharing platform designed specifically for BC students. During the hackathon, we focused on creating a user-friendly, secure, and efficient system for students to coordinate rides for trips, airport runs, and weekend outings. HackTheHeights was an amazing experience that pushed my problem-solving and development skills. We're working on refining EagleRide to bring it closer to reality!

projects.title: Pokécards
projects.description: An online platform for simplified Pokémon card battles. (In development)

projects.title: EagleRide
projects.description: EagleRide is a ride-sharing platform designed for Boston College students to coordinate and share rides efficiently. Whether you need a lift to the airport, a weekend trip, or just a ride to the city, EagleRide connects BC students with drivers heading in the same direction.
